result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter M. Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

supervisions.notes: Sentence w/held probation 1 year - costs - restitution jt/several $1514.81 Walmart in Hayward - 30 days county jail consecutive to 14 CF 207 in Ashland County and 14 CF 33 in Barron County with credit for 5 days time served  with huber may be served in Douglas County at no cost to Sawyer County to report on/before 08/14/15 by 3:00 PM - $500.00 bond forwarded to DOC to be applied to court obligations - no DNA sample can be ordered - successfully complete any conditions DOC may impose to report today to DOC.

miscConds.notes: $1514.81 Restitution   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$243.00 Fine   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
$500.00 bond forwarded to DOC to be applied to court obligations - no DNA sample can be ordered - successfully complete any conditions DOC may impose to report today to DOC.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Peter M. Thompson in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  3:05 PM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State recites plea amended to misd. retail theft party to a crime 943.50(1m)(b)4a - sentence 1 yr probation - 30 days county jail consecutive to 14 CF 207 Ashland county and Barron county case 14 CF 333 - jt/several rest. $1514.81 - costs - because of the date of offense can not request DNA sample.  Atty Moldenhauer agrees as does the defendant. State/defense stipulate.   Court questions defendant as to plea questionnaire.  Court grants amendment.  Defendant entered plea of no contest.  Court finds defendant guilty.  State argues sentencing.  Court is researching the computer as to the convictions in cases recited for other counties.   Atty Moldenhauer argues sentencing request jail be able to be served in Douglas County - 4 days credit.  Defendant addressed the Court.  Court makes stmt

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - costs - restitution jt/several $1514.81 Walmart in Hayward - 30 days county jail consecutive to 14 CF 207 in Ashland County and 14 CF 33 in Barron County with credit for 5 days time served  with huber may be served in Douglas County at no cost to Sawyer County to report on/before 08/14/15 by 3:00 PM - $500.00 bond forwarded to DOC to be applied to court obligations - no DNA sample can be ordered - successfully complete any conditions DOC may impose to report today to DOC.  Advised him right to appeal
Removed scheduling conference from 05/26/15 calendar and set for Plea/Sentencing hearing on 07/14/15 at 3:00 pm at request of parties.  NO NOTICES SENT. mak

Defendant Peter M. Thompson in court.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  special appearance by James Mclaughlin, may appoint Chris Gramstrup, waives time limits for preliminary hearing,  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
No Contact with any Wal-Mart, Jack Olson, Sarah Anderson

Defendant Peter M. Thompson in court, in custody via video.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF satisfied with video.    Acknowledges receipt of complaint, Advised of Rights and Penalties.  CBS $500.00   No Contact with any Walmart, Jack Olson, Sarah Anderson  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
